#summary Instructions for building JebGL from the source code.
#labels Featured

= Get the source =
However you want to deploy JebGL you need the latest code
{{{
svn checkout http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ jebgl
}}}
or a release (e.g. 0.1)
{{{
svn checkout http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/releases/0.1/ jebgl
}}}

= Building JebGL =
== Get jars from jebgl.googlecode.com ==
In the newly created `jebgl` directory do the following:
{{{
mkdir webstart
cd webstart
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl.all.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow.all.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/gluegen-rt.jar
cd ..
}}}
== Build JebGL ==
Now just run 
{{{
make
}}}
You should now have a jebgl.jar in your directory.

= Testing your build =
== Testing with remote jar files ==
*Note*: this does not work in Safari. Safari needs the jars coming from the same origin, see below.

Run the following in the `jebgl` directory:
{{{
python -m SimpleHTTPServer 1080
}}}
and point your browser to http://localhost:1080/test-googlecode/test.html. If all went well you should now see an oscillating red/blue pattern.

== Testing with all jar files local ==
We need to download some more jar files, so do the following:
{{{
cd webstart
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/applet-launcher.jar
}}}
This is the applet launcher that actually runs JebGL. In addition we need the native jar files (you only need the ones matching your system):
{{{
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl-natives-windows-i586.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl-natives-windows-amd64.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl-natives-linux-i586.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl-natives-linux-amd64.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/jogl-natives-macosx-universal.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow-natives-windows-i586.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow-natives-windows-amd64.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow-natives-linux-i586.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow-natives-linux-amd64.jar
wget http://jebgl.googlecode.com/svn/webstart/nativewindow-natives-macosx-universal.jar
cd ..
}}}

Now run the following command in the `jebgl` directory:
{{{
python -m SimpleHTTPServer 1080
}}}
and point your browser to http://localhost:1080/test-local/test.html.

*Note*: This only works from your local machine, as the `test.html` uses local JNLP-files which must have absolute URIs, in our case set to `localhost:1080`
